chapter.title: Manage JBoss AS from Red Hat Developer Studio

section.title: JBoss AS Installation
section.para: If you followed the default installation of Red Hat Developer Studio, you will already have a JBoss 4.2 server installed and defined. You have to do nothing to deploy your project. Just start JBoss server using a JBoss icon from command panel and launch your application. Registration to default JBoss AS is being done when you are creating an appication, in the second screen of wizard called "Web" ("Target Server" section). Simply do not uncheck the control in this section.

Besides that you can deploy your application to some servers that Red Hat Developer Studio supports directly (through the bundled Eclipse WTP plug-ins). Suppose you want to deploy the application to JBoss 4.0.5 server. First of all you need to install it.

listitem.para: Download the installation pack of JBoss 4.0.5 and save it on your computer: http://labs.jboss.com/jbossas/downloads
Double-click this file or launch the installation from terminal like this:

section.para: This will start the installation wizard and in the first window you will be proposed to choose the language for installing instructions:

listitem.para: Choose preferred language and click OK. In the next two dialogs click the Next button.
In the following window accept the license agreement and press the Next button.
Choose the place where JBoss server will be installed and click Next.
On the next step select EJB profile.
In the following window choose packs you want to be installed and click Next.
Then select installation type (advanced or standard):
When all this is done you will see the information dialog with installation settings. Click the Next button to start installation.
After installation process is complete click the button Next > Done.

section.para: That's it. JBoss server is installed. Now you should add it to server manager in Red Hat Developer Studio.

section.title: Adding and configuring JBoss server
section.para: Now we should add just installed server into server manager in Red Hat Developer Studio.

listitem.para: In the main menu select Window > Preferences > Server > Installed Runtimes.
Click the Add button to add a new server.
In the dialog that appeared choose JBoss > JBoss v4.0 and click Next.
In the next step locate the place where you have installed the server and click the Finish button.

section.para: After that JBoss server should appear in "Installed server runtimes" section.

listitem.para: Close this window by clicking OK.
Open the Servers View by selecting Window > Show View > Other > Server > Servers. You will see Servers view.
Right click anywhere in this view and select New > Server.
Select JBoss, a division of Red Hat > JBoss AS 4.0 and press Next.

Give a name to the server, locate its home directory and define JRE.
Note:
When adding a new server you will need to specify what JRE to use. It is important to set this value to a full JDK, not JRE. Again, you need a full JDK to run Web applications, JRE will not be enough.

section.title: Starting and stopping JBoss server
section.para: Starting JBoss server is quite simple. Red Hat Developer Studio allows you control its behaviour through a special toolbar: start it in regular or debug mode, stop it, or restart it.

listitem.para: To launch the server click the green colored icon on the panel or right click server name in Servers view and select "Start":
To stop the server click the button "Stop".
